text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Al-Qods (Jerusalem) committee to hold 16th session in Morocco on March 27 at the request of King Hassan.
- Public Works Minister Abdelaziz Meziane says Kuwait will finance highway linking Casablanca to nearby city of Settat and a new reservoir.
- Interior Minister Driss Basri and Dutch counterpart Hans Dijkstal preside over conference on management of public affairs in the Euro-Mediterranean region.
- Italian President Oscar Luigi Scalfaro expected in Morocco on Tuesday.
- Visiting Italian president and King Hassan to inaugurate the country's biggest water reservoir on Thursday.
- Italian president's visit is sign that ties will be reinforced.
- Moroccan Azzedine Laraki, President of the Organisation of Islamic Conference (OIC) says organisation's debts stand at $15 million.
- Italian president and Morocco king will focus in their talks on peace in the Middle East and illegal immigration.
